page.title: 08CUSTOMS IN BRAMSHAW AREA
page.content: { { HUNTING}Beagle, fox hound & buckhound packs hunt in the Forest as they have done for centuries. The indigenous rural population favours its continuance, having a more practical attitude to animal life & having possibly followed hounds on foot or on horseback since childhood. They have also scathing views about the disruptive anti-hunt saboteurs seen at meets. The middle class section is more divided in opinion although probably with a majority in favour of its continuance, as would be expected in an area which attracts those with an interest in equestrianism, high risk sport & traditional customs.
